title: Borth to Ynyslas Coastal Path Walking Route

images.title: Borth Beach by David Purchase, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Borth Beach

images.title: Bob Jones / Northern end of Borth Sands
images.caption: Northern end of Borth Sands. Looking across the River Dovey and the Aberdovey Bar. The headland in the distance is on the north bank of the Dovey estuary.

images.title: Noel Jenkins / Dunes at Ynyslas
images.caption: Dunes at Ynyslas. The boardwalk crosses an area of mobile dunes with impressive wind-blown features.

images.title: Bob Jones / Boardwalk at Twyni Bach
images.caption: Boardwalk at Twyni Bach. The boardwalk assists walkers venturing from the car park onto Borth Sands.

images.title: Caravan site at Ynyslas by John Firth, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Caravan site at Ynyslas

images.title: Sculpture by Ynyslas Visitor Centre by David Purchase, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Sculpture by Ynyslas Visitor Centre

images.title: View from Pont Aber Leri at Ynyslas by Jeremy Bolwell, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View from Pont Aber Leri at Ynyslas

description: This walk takes you from Borth to the lovely Dyfi National Nature Reserve at Ynyslas. The area is located on the beautiful Ceredigion coast, on the opposite side of the estuary to Aberdovey. The reserve consists of mudflats, sandbanks, saltmarsh, boardwalks and some tremendous high sand dunes. It's a great place for bird watching with thousands of wetland birds to look out for. Other birds inlcude skylarks, linnets, chiffchaffs, willow warbler, merlins and hen harrier. You can learn all about the flora and fauna at the excellent on site visitor centre. The walk starts in Borth and then heads north along Borth Sands for a distance of about 3.5 miles.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Dyfi Valley Way starts/ends in Borth. The long distance route takes you along the river to Llanuwchllyn, visiting the Dyfi Forest on the way.
